meanings.definition: Sordid or disreputable in character or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house on the corner looked even seamier in the dim light.
meanings.sent2: The detective knew he was in a seamier part of town when he saw the rundown buildings.
meanings.sent3: The seamier side of the city always seemed to attract trouble.
meanings.sent4: The truth behind the glamorous facade was much seamier than anyone expected.
meanings.sent5: The seamier details of the scandal were revealed in the tabloids.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of wear or neglect.
meanings.sent1: The old book had a seamier cover compared to the new one.
meanings.sent2: The seamier couch in the waiting room had seen better days.
meanings.sent3: Despite its seamier appearance, the antique dresser held sentimental value.
meanings.sent4: The seamier edges of the painting hinted at its age and history.
meanings.sent5: The seamier patches on the quilt told stories of use and love.

meanings.sent1: The seamier fabric was easier to tear along the stitching.
meanings.sent2: The seamier side of the garment needed reinforcement to prevent fraying.
meanings.sent3: The seamier edge of the tablecloth was neatly hemmed.
meanings.sent4: The seamier line down the middle of the road guided the construction workers.
meanings.sent5: The seamier seam on the pillowcase was expertly sewn.
